PageTitle: display bgp flow ipv6 peer verbose
FuncDef: The display bgp flow ipv6 peer verbose command displays BGP IPv6 FlowSpec peer detailed information.
CLIs: display bgp flow ipv6 peer [ <ipv4Addr> | <ipv6Addr> ] verbose
display bgp flow ipv6 peer verbose

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 address.
The address is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp flow ipv6 peer verbose
BGP current state: Established, Up for 00h02m15s
Configured: Active Hold Time: 180 sec   Keepalive Time:60 sec
Negotiated: Active Hold Time: 180 sec   Keepalive Time:60 sec
Peer supports bgp route refresh capability
Address family IPv6 Unicast: advertised and received
Address family FLOWv6: advertised and received
No refresh received since peer has been configured
No refresh sent since peer has been configured
Minimum route advertisement interval is 30 seconds
Route refresh capability has been enabled
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After BGP FlowSpec is enabled and a BGP FlowSpec peer relationship is established, you can run the display bgp flow ipv6 peer verbose command to query information about the BGP FlowSpec peer.
